name: hArduino
tagline: Control your Arduino board from Haskell, using the Firmata protocol
body:
hArduino
==========
[![Build Status](https://travis-ci.org/LeventErkok/hArduino.png)](http://travis-ci.org/LeventErkok/hArduino)

This project is still very much WIP. Currently:

   * It can identify if an Arduino UNO is connected via a USB port.
   * You can blink the led on the Arduino Uno. See: [Blink.hs]
(http://github.com/LeventErkok/hArduino/blob/master/System/Hardware/Arduino/Examples/Blink.hs)
   * Explore the API on Hackage: [hArduino](http://hackage.haskell.org/package/hArduino)

Note that most of the [Firmata protocol](www.firmata.org) is yet to be implemented. It has just about enough meat to blink the led on the Arduino! I expect to build the library over time to cover all of the protocol: Patches, suggestions, and improvements are most welcome!

## Thanks
The following people reported bugs, provided comments/feedback, or contributed to the development of hArduino in various ways: Alexander Altman.
